intro: Galedupa echinocalyx, commonly known as the spiny-flowered galedupa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, sometimes hairy texture. Galedupa echinocalyx is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
